intro: Crocus annulatus subvar. tenoreanus, commonly known as the Tenorean crocus, is a perennial bulbous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features showy, cup-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow, often with a distinctive purple or red eye. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm, with narrow, grass-like leaves that emerge from a central bulb. It blooms in early spring, often before the leaves are fully developed. This variety is well-suited to rock gardens and well-drained soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
